00079 /******************************************************************************\
00080  *
00081  * Routines which support write-back suppression
00082  *
00083 \******************************************************************************/
00084 
00085 static void wbs_delete_check(cb, check, current_time)
00086 L_Cb    *cb;
00087 L_Oper  *check;
00088 int     current_time;
00089 {
00090     Sched_Info  *sinfo=SCHED_INFO(check);
00091     Dep_Info    *dep_info=DEP_INFO(check);
00092     L_Dep       *dep;
00093 
00094     /* Remove check from its queued list */
00095     if (L_in_queue(scheduled_queue, sinfo))
00096        L_punt("wbs_delete_check: Deleting check that has been scheduled");
00097 
00098     L_dequeue_from_all (sinfo);
00099     
00100     /* Remove all input dependences */
00101     for (dep=dep_info->input_dep; dep!=NULL; dep=dep_info->input_dep)
00102     {
00103         Dep_Info        *from_dep_info=DEP_INFO(dep->from_oper);        
00104         int             type=dep->type;
00105 
00106         dep_info->input_dep = L_remove_dep(dep_info->input_dep, 
00107             &dep_info->n_input_dep, type, dep->from_oper, check);
00108         
00109         from_dep_info->output_dep = L_remove_dep(from_dep_info->output_dep, 
00110             &from_dep_info->n_output_dep, type, dep->from_oper, check);
00111     }
00112 
00113     /* 
00114      * make_ready will physically remove the dependence as well place the instruction in the 
00115      * pending_ready list if the instruction is ready to be scheduled.
00116      */
00117     sinfo->issue_slot=0;
00118     for (dep=dep_info->output_dep; dep!=NULL; dep=dep_info->output_dep)
00119     {
00120         L_Oper          *to_oper=dep->to_oper;
00121         Dep_Info        *to_dep_info=DEP_INFO(to_oper);
00122         Sched_Info      *to_sinfo=SCHED_INFO(to_oper);
00123         int             type=dep->type, prev_dep, num_dep,
00124                         to_index=dep->to_index,
00125                         from_index=dep->from_index;
00126 
00127         dep_info->output_dep = L_remove_dep(dep_info->output_dep,
00128             &dep_info->n_output_dep, type, check, to_oper);
00129 
00130         prev_dep = to_dep_info->n_input_dep;
00131 
00132         to_dep_info->input_dep = L_remove_dep(to_dep_info->input_dep,
00133             &to_dep_info->n_input_dep, type, check, to_oper);
00134 
00135         /* L_remove_dep can remove multiple dependences of a given type */
00136         num_dep = prev_dep-to_dep_info->n_input_dep;
00137         if (num_dep <= 0)
00138             L_punt("wbs_delete_check: dependence not removed!");
00139         else
00140             if (num_dep>1)
00141                 to_sinfo->num_depend-=(num_dep-1);
00142 
00143         /*
00144          * We must make sure that dependent instruction is correctly
00145          * moved to pending_ready list if there are no more
00146          * dependences.
00147          */
00148         Lsched_make_ready(cb, current_time, sinfo, to_sinfo, to_index,
00149             from_index, dep->distance);
00150     }
00151 
00152     /* Free up all allocated memory */
00153     L_delete_dependence_info(dep_info);
00154     L_free_oper_mdes_info (check);
00155     L_delete_sched_info(sinfo);
00156 
00157     if (Lsched_debug_messages)
00158        fprintf (stdout, "> deleting check op %d\n", check->id);
00159 
00160     /* Delete the check instruction */
00161     L_delete_oper(cb, check);
00162 
00163 }
00164 
00165 void wbs_insert_check(cb)
00166 L_Cb            *cb;
00167 {
00168     L_Oper      *check=NULL, *oper, *dep_oper;
00169     Sched_Info  *check_sinfo, *sinfo;
00170     int         current_block = 0, branch, last_op,
00171                 in_index, out_index, distance, suppress,
00172                 check_current_block;
00173 
00174     out_index = operand_index(MDES_SYNC_OUT, DEP_CNT_OPERAND);
00175     in_index = operand_index(MDES_SYNC_IN, DEP_CNT_OPERAND);
00176 
00177 #if 0
00178         if (cb->id==23)
00179             L_print_cb(stdout, NULL, cb);
00180 #endif
00181 
00182     for (oper=cb->first_op; oper!=NULL; oper=oper->next_op)
00183     {
00184         if (oper->ext==NULL) continue;
00185 
00186         sinfo = SCHED_INFO(oper);
00187 
00188 #if 0
00189         if (cb->id==23)
00190             L_print_oper(stdout, oper);
00191 #endif
00192 
00193         current_block = sinfo->current_block;
00194 
00195         if (sinfo->proc_opc==Lop_CHECK)
00196             check = oper;
00197         
00198         branch = Lsched_is_branch(sinfo->proc_opc);
00199         last_op = (oper==cb->last_op);
00200 
00201         if (branch || last_op)
00202         {
00203             if ((current_block!=0) && (!check))
00204             {
00205                 /* create the check instruction and initialize all parameters */
00206                 check = L_create_new_op(Lop_CHECK);
00207                 check->weight = sinfo->weight;
00208                 check->dep_info = (void *) L_new_dep_info();
00209 
00210                 L_build_oper_mdes_info (check);
00211 
00212                 check->ext = (Sched_Info *) 
00213                     L_create_sched_info(check, current_block, sinfo->prev_br, 
00214                         sinfo->oper);
00215 
00216                 if (branch)
00217                     L_insert_oper_after(cb, oper->prev_op, check);
00218                 else
00219                     L_insert_oper_after(cb, oper, check);
00220             }
00221 
00222             /* 
00223              * If we have determined that we should not create a check,
00224              * we certainly should not add dependences to it!!
00225              */
00226             if (!check) continue;
00227 
00228             check_sinfo = SCHED_INFO(check);
00229 
00230             /* 
00231              * Make the check instruction control dependent on previous
00232              * and subsequent branch
00233              */
00234             check_sinfo->prev_br = sinfo->prev_br;
00235 
00236             if (check_sinfo->prev_br!=NULL)
00237             {
00238                 if (!L_find_dep(DEP_INFO(check)->input_dep, 
00239                     check_sinfo->prev_br, check, L_DEP_CNT))
00240                 {
00241                     distance = max_operand_time(sinfo->mdes_info, out_index)
00242                         - min_operand_time(check_sinfo->mdes_info, in_index);
00243     
00244                     if (distance<0) distance=0;
00245         
00246                     L_add_dep(L_DEP_CNT, distance, out_index, in_index, check_sinfo->prev_br, check, 0);
00247                 }
00248             }
00249 
00250             if ( branch )
00251             {
00252                 if (!L_find_dep(DEP_INFO(check)->output_dep, check, 
00253                     oper, L_DEP_CNT))
00254                 {
00255 
00256                     check_sinfo->post_br = oper;
00257 
00258                     distance = min_operand_time(check->mdes_info, in_index)
00259                         - max_operand_time(sinfo->mdes_info, out_index);
00260 
00261                     if (distance<0) distance=0;
00262 
00263                     L_add_dep(L_DEP_CNT, distance, in_index, out_index, check, oper, 0);
00264                 }
00265             }
00266             else
00267                 check_sinfo->post_br=NULL;
00268 
00269 
00270             /*
00271              * Make the check instruction control dependent on all 
00272              * previous potentially excepting instructions in the control
00273              * block
00274              */
00275             check_current_block = check_sinfo->current_block;
00276 
00277             for (dep_oper = cb->first_op; dep_oper != check; 
00278                  dep_oper=dep_oper->next_op)
00279             {
00280                 /* 
00281                  * Note:  this code is assuming that the check and branch
00282                  * will not be potentially excepting instructions.
00283                  */
00284                 if (IS_EXCEPTING(dep_oper->proc_opc) &&
00285                     (SCHED_INFO(dep_oper)->home_block==check_current_block) &&
00286                     !L_find_dep(check_sinfo->dep_info->input_dep, dep_oper, 
00287                     check, L_DEP_CNT))
00288 
00289                 {
00290                     distance = max_operand_time(MDES_INFO(dep_oper), 
00291                         out_index) - min_operand_time(check_sinfo->mdes_info, 
00292                         in_index);
00293 
00294                     if (distance<0) distance=0;
00295     
00296                     L_add_dep(L_DEP_CNT, distance, out_index, in_index, dep_oper, check, 0);
00297                 }
00298             }
00299 
00300             /*
00301              * Make the check instruction control dependent on all
00302              * potentially excepting instructions that are exactly 
00303              * except_branch_perc_limit control blocks later.
00304              */
00305 
00306             if (Ldep_except_branch_perc_limit != -1)
00307             {
00308                 suppress = check_current_block+Ldep_except_branch_perc_limit;
00309 
00310                 for (dep_oper = cb->last_op; dep_oper != check; 
00311                     dep_oper=dep_oper->prev_op)
00312                 {
00313                     /* 
00314                      * Note: this code is assuming that the check and branch
00315                      * will not be potentially excepting instructions.
00316                      */
00317                     if (IS_EXCEPTING(dep_oper->proc_opc) &&
00318                         (SCHED_INFO(dep_oper)->home_block==suppress) &&
00319                         !L_find_dep(check_sinfo->dep_info->output_dep, check, 
00320                         dep_oper, L_DEP_CNT))
00321                     {
00322                         distance = min_operand_time(check_sinfo->mdes_info, in_index) 
00323                             - max_operand_time(MDES_INFO(dep_oper), out_index);
00324            
00325                         if (distance<0) distance=0;
00326                
00327                         L_add_dep(L_DEP_CNT, distance, in_index, out_index, check, dep_oper, 0);
00328                     }
00329                 }
00330             }
00331 
00332             if (oper->next_op == check)
00333                 oper = check;
00334 
00335             check = NULL;
00336         }
00337     }
00338 }
00339 
00340 /* 
00341  * This routine will extend the live range of operands for all
00342  * potentially excepting instructions.  It will also indicate
00343  * the point which speculated instructions should maximally
00344  * be demoted to prevent unecessary spill code
00345  *
00346  * The demotion point is determined for all speculated instructions!
00347  */
00348 void wbs_extend_live_range(cb)
00349 L_Cb *cb;
00350 {
00351     int spec_dist;
00352     L_Oper *oper, *ext_oper;
00353     Sched_Info  *sinfo, *ext_sinfo;
00354 
00355     /*
00356      * Determine if the live range for potentially excepting instructions
00357      * should be extended to prevent register allocation from corrupting
00358      * source operands.
00359      */
00360     for (oper=cb->first_op; oper!=NULL; oper=oper->next_op)
00361     {
00362         /*
00363          * Search backwards through cb to determine if their is an
00364          * operation with an earlier home block located below
00365          * this operation.
00366          *
00367          * The first operation encountered determines where to extend
00368          * the live range of the source operands.
00369          */
00370         sinfo = SCHED_INFO(oper);
00371 
00372         if ( !sinfo ) continue;
00373 
00374         spec_dist = sinfo->home_block - sinfo->current_block;
00375 
00376         if (spec_dist > 0)
00377         {
00378             for (ext_oper=sinfo->prev_br; ext_oper!=oper; 
00379                  ext_oper=ext_oper->prev_op)
00380             {
00381                 ext_sinfo = SCHED_INFO(ext_oper);
00382 
00383                 if (!ext_sinfo) continue;
00384 
00385                 /* 
00386                  * We stop extending the live range when we find the first
00387                  * instruction above the home block of the speculated 
00388                  * potential excepting instruction that has a destination
00389                  * register.
00390                  */
00391                 if ( (ext_sinfo->home_block < sinfo->home_block) &&
00392                      (ext_oper->dest!=NULL) )
00393                     break;
00394             }
00395 
00396             if (IS_EXCEPTING(oper->proc_opc))
00397                 sinfo->extend_lr_down = ext_oper;
00398 
00399         }
00400     }
00401 }
00402 
00403 void wbs_remove_check(cb, branch_sinfo, current_time)
00404     L_Cb        *cb;
00405     Sched_Info  *branch_sinfo;
00406     int         current_time;
00407 {
00408     L_Dep       *tdep;
00409     Sched_Info  *tsinfo = NULL;
00410     Dep_Info    *tdep_info = NULL, *dep_info=branch_sinfo->dep_info;
00411     L_Oper      *tdep_oper=NULL;
00412 
00413     if (!Lsched_is_branch(branch_sinfo->proc_opc)) return;
00414  
00415     /* Search for a check instruction */
00416     for (tdep=dep_info->output_dep; tdep!=NULL;
00417          tdep=tdep->next_dep)
00418     {
00419         if (tdep->to_oper->proc_opc==Lop_CHECK)
00420         {
00421             tdep_oper=tdep->to_oper;
00422             tsinfo=SCHED_INFO(tdep_oper);
00423             tdep_info=DEP_INFO(tdep_oper);
00424             break;
00425         }
00426     }
00427 
00428     /*
00429      * If no input dependent instructions have been speculated,
00430      * delete the check
00431      */
00432     if ( (tdep_oper!=NULL) &&
00433          (tsinfo->num_depend==tdep_info->n_input_dep) )
00434         wbs_delete_check(cb, tdep_oper, current_time);
00435 }
